intro: Passovia brasiliana, commonly known as the Brazilian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
